Articles.Content: Ok guys I don't know if this is supposed to go here but I need this cleared up. I have heard through you tube that vanilla is out and that you can mine fuel from this update but I can't figure out how to so I think I misunderstood. So does this make kethane fuel obsolete? And this leads me to My next question does kethane work in the .19 update? Also can someone please explain just what the vanilla update is. Srry if I sound like a noob, it cause I am.

Mining is not in this update. It may be in the .20 update

http://kerbaldevteam.tumblr.com/post/45540856025/0-19-out-you-betcha
Mining is not yet implemented,(probably in 0.20 or later) so kethane is not obsolete. And yes,as far as i know kethane does work in 0.19.1.

Does anyone have a link for the current debugger for Kethane? Alternately is there another way to replenish or increase the default deposit size? The deposit sizes seem way under. Once you start converting it into LP, OX and MP it goes a lot faster than I had imagined and deposits run out way faster than they probably should.

Does anyone have a link for the current debugger for Kethane? Alternately is there another way to replenish or increase the default deposit size? The deposit sizes seem way under. Once you start converting it into LP, OX and MP it goes a lot faster than I had imagined and deposits run out way faster than they probably should.

The deposit sizes are set in the source code, you'd have to download it from Github, make changes then rebuild the files.

Ah, but if you had huge unlimited fields of the stuff that'd make life far, far too easy (Kethane as it stands is a very easy way of getting fuel, it sounds like the official system will be a lot more complex).

I'd still have a place for Kethane even when stock resources are out. But then, it will be just one of many.

Edit: Woo! Post number 333!
